subject: Philosophy
title: Stoicism in the Digital Age
description: A fast breakdown of Stoicism in the Digital Age for builders.

hook.text: Social media is designed to trigger outrage, envy, and comparison. Stoics saw this coming.

buildup.text: Epictetus warned against comparing yourself to others. Marcus cautioned against chasing approval.

discovery.text: Digital Stoicism means noticing when a notification hijacks your attention â€” and choosing not to react.

twist.text: The algorithms exploit exactly what Stoics trained against: impulsive emotional reactions.

climax.text: In an age of constant stimulation, the ancient Stoic practice of pausing has never been more relevant.

punchline.text: The scroll is infinite. Your attention isn't.

quiz.question: How does Stoicism apply to social media use?
options: By training you to pause before reacting impulsively
By encouraging you to quit all technology
By telling you to suppress curiosity
